intro: Aegopogon quinquesetus, commonly known as the five-lobed goosgrass, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically wind-pollinated flowers. The plant has slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often hairy. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Aegopogon quinquesetus is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich environments.
